Description: "A Hamas militant was killed and four Israeli soldiers wounded in a suicide car bombing on a Gaza Strip settlement."
Context: Bit over a week after killing of Rantissi. Israeli plans (from before that event and killing of Yassin) to pull out of Gaza.

Description: "Two Israeli soldiers were slightly wounded Tuesday when an anti-tank missile exploded near their position on the edge of the Kfar Darom settlement in the central Gaza Strip, Israeli army sources said."

Thai worker at Kfar Darom settlement in Gaza died of mortar shrapnel wound.

An assailant was supposed to infiltrate the settlement "under cover of 'Qassam rockets fired against the settlement,' " but he failed to get inside, did not detonate, and managed to escape.

1 Palestinian on a tractor killed by Israeli soldiers, I assume by accident caught in crossfire.
Context: Plans to pull out of Gaza.

Description:
"Palestinian militants set off a massive explosion in a tunnel they had dug underneath an army post in the southern Gaza Strip, military sources said."

One soldier later died (source 271, also source for incident 200).
Context: Said was revenge for killing of Yassin and Rantissi

Description: Qassam rockets fired at Sderot hit kindergarten, killing 2 including a 3-year-old.
Context: Israel launches air raid on Gaza City in response (273). Also occupies northern Gaza and pledges to remain there until Israel withdraws from the Gaza strip at the end of 2005.

Description: Two salvos of Qassams fired. Most caused no damage, while one injured one person in Sderot's industrial zone.
Context: "Israeli troops moved into the northern Gaza town of Beit Hanun early Tuesday, in an operation that the military said was designed to stop the firing of Qassam rockets, which are named after Hamas's military wing."

Description: Three Qassams fired into Israel. Two Israelis treated for psychological shock.
Context: Israeli army had moved into northern Gaza a few days earlier in response to a rocket launch on June 28 that killed 2 in Sderor (see incident 200).

Description: 2 bombers, 2 buses in Beersheva.
Context:
Comes after a long period of quiet as heightened security and intense Israeli attacks on Hamas had made attacking Israel increasiongly difficult.

In response, Israel seals off Hebron (278), blows up home of one suicide bomber and "partly destroys" that of the other (279), and threatens a strike against Syria (280). (Hamas external political leadership resident in Damascus.)

Description: Rocket landed harmlessly in Sderot.
Context: "Hamas supporters [had] immediately called for revenge attacks after the raid by Israeli combat aircraft on a football pitch where the Hamas members were undergoing military training."

Description: "Palestinian militants managed to fire seven rockets Wednesday. They struck Israel's southern Negev desert without causing casualties, although a factory was reported damaged."
Context: Troops entered northern Gaza Strip overnight (either Tuesday or Wednesday or both) in response to rockets Tuesday (see incident 204). Escalation continues on Israeli side (source 283).

Description: Rocket landed in Sderot w/ no casualties
Context:
The "Hamas movement... said it was a first response to the killing of one of its fighters in an Israeli air strike in Gaza City late Sunday."

"Israeli troops withdrew from the northern Gaza Strip earlier this month after an operation designed to put an end to the near daily firing of Qassams, which take their name from Hamas' armed wing."

Description: 3 rockets. "Two of the missiles hit the town of Sderot and damaged a warehouse while the third struck a communal farm, or kibbutz, without hurting anyone, the [police] sources said."
Context: "Israel's army has stepped up its raids into the Gaza Strip in recent months to try to prevent the firing of rockets at Israel."

Description: 2 children died in hospital of wounds sustained when rocket landed in Sderot. 4 rockets landed there in total.
Context: Rocket attack "capped a day of violence in which seven Palestinians were shot dead by Israeli troops in the occupied territories."

Description: 1 rocket hits uninhabited sector of s. Israel
Context: Recent pull-out of n. Gaza after heavy Israeli offensive

Description: "Four Israeli soldiers were wounded Thursday in a mortar attack on an army base near a Jewish settlement in the southern Gaza Strip claimed by the radical Palestinian movement Hamas."
Context: "Morag, which lies to the north of the southern Palestinian town of Rafah, is one of 21 Gaza settlements which are due to be dismantled next year as part of Prime Minister Ariel Sharon's controversial disengagement plan."

Description:
"Dan Amiel, 19, of Kfar Darom was fighting for his life Sunday night after being wounded by shrapnel when a mortar shell exploded in the settlement on Sunday morning."
"The shell was one of 17 mortar shells fired at settlements in central and southern Gaza during the morning."
Context: "The sharp increase in the mortar attacks comes a week after the army launched Operation King's Court in the Khan Yunis refugee camp in an attempt to distance the mortar fire from settlements."

Description: 4 mortars fired. 4 Israeli soldiers to hospital after 2 apparent mortar shells landed in Nissanit settlement.
2 Qassams landed harmlessly in Negev desert.
Context: Recent death of Arafat. See incident 214, too.

Description: Mortar landed in Netzarim settlement in s. Gaza causing minor damage, no injuries reported.
Context: Recent death of Arafat. See incident 213 for rocket attack same day.

Description: 5 Mortars fired by Hamas at Neve Dekalim settlement, injuring "at least 2."
Context: Palestinian scrambling to find Arafat successor and avoid civil war.

Description: "Four Israeli soldiers were killed Sunday when Palestinian militants blew up a tunnel under an army post in Gaza"
Context:
"Jailed intifada leader Marwan Barghuti pulled out of the Palestinian elections."

The explosion... triggered a fierce bout of fighting which left at least one Palestinian civilian dead."

Description: One Thai woman killed and two other Thai workers injured in mortar attack on Ganei Tal settlement in s. Gaza Strip.

An Israeli soldier was wounded. He "was on duty inside Israel, close to the security fence on the border with Gaza."

Not known if military specifically targeted, but if rocket aimed at area right near fence, this is most probable.

"spate of rocket attacks which injured one civilian in the southern Israeli town of Sderot."

"the Ezzedine al-Qassam Brigades said in a statement it fired three rockets at Sderot at around 6:30 am (0430 GMT)."

Army said at least 2 fired at Sderot. 4 launched over weekend.
Context:
Pullout from Gaza planned for end 2005.

Response: Israeli incursion into northern Gaza Strip.

See related attack incident 220.

Description: Mortar explosion critically wounds man in Erez industrial zone in northern Gaza Strip.
Context: See related attack incident 219 as well as its context notes.

Description: 12 soldiers wounded in rocket attack on IDF base near northern border (not clear which side, think within Gaza.
Context: See incidents 222-3

Description:
"At least 10 mortar shells were fired at settlements in Gush Katif and in the northern Gaza Strip on Wednesday."

None wounded.
Context: See incidents 221 and 223.

Description: "...two Kassam rockets were fired at Sderot and Kibbutz Givim in the western Negev. No one was wounded in any of the attacks, but damage was caused to some 20 homes on the kibbutz."
Context: See incidents 221-2

Description:
6 (source 303) Israelis killed in bombing/shooting attack with 3 assailants who blew themselves up at the Karni cargo crossing ("Gaza's main lifeline") between Israel and southern Gaza.
Bombers were from Al Aqsa, Qassam Brigades, and Popular Resistance Committees.

Not sure on location (could have technically been within Gaza Strip, as it was a border crossing).
Context:
1st suicide attack since election of Mahmoud Abbas.

Israel seals off strip in response, holds off on retaliation to give Abbas "a chance to reign in violent groups" (303).

Description:
Not specified if wounded soldiers or civilians, but apparently the bomber blew himself up in a room where he'd been taken by soldiers to be searched, so I'm assuming the target was military.

Reports also did not specify if killed or wounded, with one report saying "lightly wounded" while saying they were evacuated by helicopter.
Context: Still giving Abbas time to reign in violence.

Description: "The armed wing of Hamas said it had responded by firing a total of seven mortars against the settlement of Neve Dekalim and also targeted the nearby Atzmona settlement. An Israeli military spokeswoman reported that six mortar shells had been fired in southern Gaza but without causing injuries."
Context:
Ceasefire continuing on condition that Israel ends operations in Gaza Strip. Hamas claims shelling only response to the shooting of a 10-yr-old girl in Rafah.

Israel responds to this incident by putting West Bank security transfer on hold (306).

Description:
"Five mortar shells were fired at settlements in Gush Katif and northern Gaza on Tuesday, bringing the total number of mortars fired in the past 24 hours to thirteen."

No injuries, though two were treated for "shock."
Context: See incident 226

Description:
"An Israeli army spokeswoman said 22 mortars landed in the main Gush Katif settlement bloc in southern Gaza over a four-hour period as well as one makeshift Qassam rocket, named after Hamas's armed wing.
-"After a lull of several hours, three more mortars landed in the nearby Morag settlement, again without causing injuries.
-"An anti-tank shell was also fired at an Israeli army position near the settlement of Neve Dekalim, in the same area, without causing any injuries."
Context: Abbas demanded ceasefire. Attacks occured "despite the presence of thousands of Palestinian security forces in Gaza with specific instructions to prevent such attacks."

Description: "The Israeli military said that 14 mortars landed around the Gaza Strip's main settlement bloc of Gush Katif, slightly damaging a building, in an attack later claimed by Hamas in a telephone call to AFP."
Context:
Semi-ceasefire since January. No incidents at all in March, quiet in April, too.

Attack occured "after Israeli soldiers shot dead three Palestinian youths" in Jerusalem.

Description: "...militant groups such as Hamas and Islamic Jihad responded with a volley of more than 70 rockets and mortars at Jewish settlements."
Context: "...news emerged that three teenagers had been shot dead by Israeli soldiers close to the Gaza-Egypt border in disputed circumstances..."

Description: "a rocket landed in the yard of a house in Sderot, an Israeli town just outside Gaza, but did not explode. Also, a mortar shell exploded in an Israeli army base just outside Gaza, causing some damage but no injuries, and two rockets hit the Karni crossing point into Israel, the military said."
Context: Israel responds with attack against mortar cells (312).

Description:
"Two Palestinian workers and a Chinese national were killed in an attack on this Gaza Strip Jewish settlement Tuesday claimed by the Islamic militant group Hamas, Israeli army and medical sources said."

Ganei Tal settlement.
Context:
Settlement due to be evacuated later in the year.

Israel launches attacks against Hamas and an incursion into Gaza in response (315).

Description: "A rocket fired from Gaza by Palestinians killed a woman in an Israeli village just outside the territory."
Context:
Triggered "four Israeli air raids and a confrontation between Palestinian police and armed militants and endangering a five-month truce."

See related incident 234.

Description:
"Rockets also (see incident 233) exploded in an army base and a Gaza settlement, slightly wounding several Israelis."

Number of wounded not reported. 5 just my way to estimate "several" and to indicate that it was not "zero."
Context:
"In the past, Israel has retaliated for such rocket barrages by sending tanks into northern Gaza, but it has refrained from that since a truce was declared on Feb. 8."

It did lead to air raids, which were "the most widespread in Gaza since the truce was declared."

Description: Hamas fired rockets and mortars at Israeli targets from the Gaza Strip. No further info provided. Assuming therefore no casualties. Target unkown.
Context:
Truce allegedly still ongoing. Israeli attacks on Gaza. Abbas condemns rocket attacks on Israel.

Pullout from Gaza to occur next month.

Description: Rocket landed in Sderot--no injuries. Assuming Hamas, as it was a Qassam, but this is not clear. Qassams, later on at least, are also shot by other groups.
Context: Israeli pullout from Gaza.

Description: Palestinian militants fired three more rockets from Gaza into an Israeli border town on Saturday, bringing the two-day total to 34, the Israeli military said.
Context:
"came despite a deadly Israeli air strike in Gaza and a threat of more massive retaliation."

"Israel vowed Sunday [25 September] to wage a sustained campaign against the militant Palestinian group Hamas after launching bombing raids on its Gaza Strip stronghold and arresting its leaders in the West Bank" (321).
Then: Hamas announces end to rocket attacks (322).

Description:
West Bank settler from Pisgat Zeev taken hostage then killed.

" 'We had intended to exchange the Zionist hostage for Palestinian prisoners, but the occupation force's campaign of arrests in the West Bank led us to kill him,' said the armed wing of Hamas."
Context:
Continued heavy military action against Hamas by Israel, re-election of Sharon gov't, support for Bush for offensive against Hamas.

Israel arrests around 400 Hamas militants in three-days around this time (324).

Description:
"The Ezzedine al-Qassam Brigades said it had fired seven rockets, including one at the southern Israeli town of Ashkelon."

"An Israeli military spokesman confirmed six rockets were fired Saturday, of which one reached Israeli territory without causing damage or injury."
Context:
"in response to the killing Friday of 10 Palestinians in Israeli artillery fire and other raids."

"Hamas said Saturday it had fired rockets at Israel for the first time since a one-and-a-half year truce came into effect."

Truce thus ended by aforementioned beach attack.

Description:
"Islamic Jihad, Hamas and a radical Fatah offshoot, the Al-Aqsa Martyrs' Brigades, all claimed responsibility for a series of early morning rocket attacks on southern Israel.
One landed on a house in Sderot, the home town of Peretz, leaving the owner seriously injured."
Context: Recently broken cease-fire after an alleged Israeli attack on Hamas militant killed several Palestinians on a Gaza beach.

Description: "No one was wounded by any of the nine missiles which were detected as having been fired from northern Gaza which mostly fell harmlessly in the southern Negev desert."
Context: "Hamas, which has largely held off such attacks since the start of last year, announced a resumption of the rocket firing in response to the killing of eight Palestinians on a beach in Gaza, apparently the result of Israeli shelling."

Description:
Hamas, the Popular Resistance Committees, and the "previously unknown" Army of Islam group claimed joint responsibility.

"Militants tunneled into Israel and launched... grenades and rockets at an army border post near southern Gaza."
Context:
"The militant groups said the dawn assault was revenge for the 22 civilians killed in an alleged Israeli shelling and botched air strikes since the start of June."

Soldier also abducted, see incident 244.

Israel vows revenge.

Description:
Gilad Shalit abducted. Hamas, the Popular Resistance Committees, and the "previously unknown" Army of Islam group claimed joint responsibility.

Additional context (no room left!): Israel vows to respond harshly, ends up attacking a power station and two bridges, knocking out power to most of Gaza Strip (332). Assault continues...
Context:
-See incident 243, of which this is part.
-Somewhat oddly, Hamas deputy PM al-Shaer demanded the soldier's release.
-" 'The occupation will not get any information about the missing soldier, except after committing to first immediately release all women prisoners from Israeli prisoners,' the three groups said in a statement.
'Secondly, (we demand) the immediate release of all children under 18 years,' they added."

Description: Rocket hits ASHKELON for the first time; hits a school (must have been empty).
Context:
Hamas + 2 others continue to hold Shalit among heavy Israeli attacks on Gaza as a result of hostage-taking.

Israel approves invasion of Gaza and creation of buffer zone next day (334).

Description:
"Rockets fired from the Gaza Strip hit a factory in the southern town of Sderot on Sunday, injuring one person."

"The militant group Hamas took responsibility for firing rockets toward Israel at about the same time Sderot was hit."
Context: "Israel on June 28 launched a military offensive in the Gaza Strip in part to stop the firing of the rockets."

Description:
Rocket struck a woman in Sderot, "150 yards from the home of Israeli Defense Minister Amir Peretz."

"The rocket also badly wounded a member of the minister's security detail. Another rocket fired later at Sderot seriously wounded a teenager, the rescue service said."
Context:
Peretz promises harsh response.

"Israel's latest military operation against rocket squads, an offensive in Beit Hanoun, ended last week.... For more than a week, troops backed by attack helicopters and tanks went after rocket squads in the town. They killed about 50 militants and at least seven civilians.... One Israeli soldier died in the offensive."

Description: Rockets fired at Sderot, 1 person taken to hospital w/ shrapnel injuries.

""Troops saw a woman approaching them in a suspicious manner and identified her carrying an explosive device," an army spokeswoman said.

"They then threw a stun grenade in her direction but she managed to blow herself up," she added, adding that three soldiers were lightly hurt."

57-yr-old woman was grandmother of 41!
Context: "The operation came two weeks after the radical faction threatened to resume suicide bombings in response to a botched Israeli shelling in the Gaza town of Beit Hanun that killed 19 Palestinians, mostly women and children."

Description:
Two rockets hit Sderot in the morning. Hamas and PIJ issued competing claims of responsibility.

Hamas govt condemned the launch, saying it violated the ceasefire.
Context:
Ceasire agreed among Palestinian factions, with Israel saying it would pull out of Gaza if the rockets stopped.
" 'We will have to discuss any violation of this (ceasefire) agreement,' [Ghazi] Hamad said. 'Everyone is included in this agreement which is signed by everyone, including by Islamic Jihad....'
"Islamic Jihad, however, renounced the ceasefire after Israel launched fresh operations in the West Bank overnight" (340).

Description:
"An Israeli electricity worker was shot and wounded by Palestinian gunfire at the Karni crossing between Israel and the Gaza Strip on Monday in an attack claimed by the armed wing of Hamas.

The civilian employee of an electricity company was shot as he repaired a high voltage line near the crossing, the army said."
Context: Lots of Hamas-Fatah fighting. Gilad Shalit poker continues.

Description: "Hamas militants claimed they launched 41 rockets and 54 mortar shells on Tuesday. The Israeli military said it could confirm only six rockets and eight mortars. Two of the rockets fell in Israel, the army said, causing no casualties or damage."
Context:
"retaliating for deadly Israeli raids in the Palestinian territories"

Truce since November: "Israel stopped most of its military activity but kept Gaza in a stranglehold by closing vital crossings, citing security threats. And while Hamas rocket squads stayed on the sidelines, other groups, like Islamic Jihad, kept up fire of homemade rockets almost daily at Israeli towns and villages just outside Gaza."

Description: Five rockets launched, hitting a house and a school. Assume school was in Sderot, house definitely was. Mother in house seriously wounded, son moderately. 15 others treated for "shock" (I count only physical wounding here).
Context:
"...retaliation for Israel's killing a militant during an attack near a border crossing earlier Tuesday and also to commemorate the May 15 founding of Israel in 1948, known to Palestinians as al-Naqba, of 'the catastrophe.' "

"Israel hit back with airstrikes at open spaces in northern Gaza, the military said. Palestinian officials said no one was hurt."

Description: 2 women in Sderot injured, one seriously, one moderately.
Context: "The attack came hours after an Israeli air raid killed two people and wounded 30 in the Hamas training camp in Gaza's southern town of Rafah in response to the continuing rocket attacks."

Description:
Rocket hits Sderot car, kills woman who was approaching car (dies of injuries on way to hospital) and wounds two others.

1st Israeli killed in rocket attack since November.
Context: Heavy Israeli attacks on Hamas Gaza targets in response to previous rocket fire.

Description: Rocket hits courtyard of home in Sderot, wounding 3.
Context: Israeli planes pound Gaza.

Description: 4 soldiers at an Israeli army base at the Erez crossing were wounded, one seriously.
Context: The attack came shortly Prime Minister Ehud Olmert said he would not negotiate a cease-fire with Palestinian militants firing rockets.

Description: 2 rockets fired, no injuries or damage.
Context: Hamas now controls Gaza.

Description:
"Palestinian gunmen fired at a bus stop near the settlement of Ariel. A previously unknown offshoot of Fatah, the movement headed by Palestinian President Mahmoud Abbas, had taken responsibility for the shooting. But Hamas said Friday in a statement on its Web site that it was responsible."

Israeli soldier seriously wounded.

AFP asserts Hamas claim more credible.
Gun attack on 3 settlers hiking near Hebron. 2 killed, who shot back before dying, killing one of the Palestinians.
Context: "It was the deadliest attack in the occupied West Bank since at least the start of the year." --a long time

Description:
"A suicide bomber died in Monday's attack in a shopping centre in the southern city of Dimona as well as the woman civilian. A second bomber was shot by police, medics said."

NB: J. Post says 40 wounded (source 355), but often includes those suffering from pyschological "shock" as wounded, which I have not done in other incidents as my most important source throughout the conflict, the AFP, counts only the physically injured.
Context:
First Hamas claim of suicide bombing since Novemer 2006 (see incident 249).
"The Israeli military pounded Hamas in its Gaza Strip bastion on Tuesday killing nine militants."
"Hamas responded to the repeated ground and air raids against its fighters in Gaza with a salvo of a dozen rockets against the southern Israeli town of Sderot" (see incident 263).

Description: "Hamas [launched] a dozen rockets against the southern Israeli town of Sderot, one of which slammed into a house wounding two civilians, security sources said."
Context: Response to repeated ground and air raids against it by IDF in Gaza (see incident 262).

Description:
"A rocket fired from Gaza Wednesday wounded two young sisters as they played outside their home."

Not clear if Hamas claimed responsibility, article says Hamas ALSO claimed responsibility for Monday's suicide attack (incident 262), implying it had also done so for rockets. In any case, rockets def. attributed to Hamas.
Context: "Israel's air force attacked Gaza militants and a top Israeli Cabinet Minister declared an all-front war on Hamas rapid-fire incidents that threatened to bury U.S.-led Mideast peace efforts."

Description: "Almost 29 rockets were fired toward southern Israel on Friday, the army said.... Two buildings were hit, including a house, Israeli media reported. Two people were injured, medics said."
Context: "The Islamic Hamas said Friday the cutback in the power supply would not force it to stop the attacks."

Description: "A Palestinian rocket slammed into a college campus in southern Israel on Wednesday, killing one man and lightly wounding a second person, Israeli medical officials said."
Context:
"The rocket barrage came hours after an Israeli airstrike killed five Hamas militants in the Gaza Strip."

In general, heavy Israeli crackdown on Hamas. Threat exchanges back and forth (Israel will target Hamas political leaders, Hamas will kill Shalit if it does, etc.) (see incident 267).

Description:
"Several Grad rockets slammed into Ashkelon... on Thursday, including one... that landed near a school, wounding a 17-year-old girl."

Talk in article refers to Hamas smuggling these rockets and possessing only a few. It thus seems that they attribute any Grad rocket to Hamas. No claim of responsibility (CoR) in report.

A Grad rocket hit the day before, too. Again, no CoR.
Context: "On Thursday, Israel carried out more than 10 airstrikes in northern and central Gaza, beginning just after midnight and stretching well into the afternoon, Palestinians said. The army said it was targeting rocket squads, and blamed militants for operating in populated areas. Civilian casualties were unintended, the army said."

Description:
Six people were wounded in Ashkelon on Saturday, after one rocket landed next to City Hall and another in the marina area.

Talk in report is of Hamas's improved rocket capabilities. Seems assumption is these rockets were launched by Hamas.
Context: "The army over the weekend installed its "Code Red" siren system in Ashkelon to alert of any future incoming rockets and on Sunday, Israeli emergency services began providing first-aid courses to instruct residents how to act in the event of an attack."

Description: Another (see incident 268) rocket struck Ashkelon on Sunday. One person was slightly wounded, medics said.
Context: See incident 268.

Description: Hamas and a "hitherto unknown group" claimed responsibility for a shooting attack on Israeli minister Avi Dichter's aide Mati Gil "when they opened fire from the Gaza Strip on an Israeli kibbutz that the minister was visiting."
Context: Tentative calm, but overall tensions high. Just 8 months before 2008-9 Gaza War (Operation Cast Lead).

Description:
Hamas rigged two jeeps disguised as those of Israeli army with explosives and drove them at the Kerem Shalom crossing. One exploded near an army watchtower, the other near a patrol. Of wounded, 8 hospitalized.

Heavy mortar fire directed at area as cover, too. Morning fog also helped Hamas.
Context: Just before start of Passover

Description:
Mortar fire on Kfar Aza, a communal farm in s. Israel.

"Abu Obeida, a spokesman for Hamas' military wing, said militants had targeted an Israeli military position, but the mortar went astray." Have thus indicated target as military, even though it did not work out that way.
Context: "Asked if the deadly attack Friday wouldn't make it more difficult for Egypt to conclude a truce, Abu Obeida replied, 'We will continue to fire until the last moment' before a cease-fire is completed. Israel has not publicly acknowledged truce efforts, though it has said that if militants halt their fire, the military will stop its Gaza raids."

Description: Gaza rocket hits a kibbutz in s. Israel. 3 seriously wounded.
Context: Ongoing Gaza blockade.

Description:
"More than 50 mortar shells, Kassam and Katyusha rockets were fired into Israel from Gaza."
One woman at a Kibbutz was injured.
Context:
Immeditely followed powerful explosion at the home of a Hamas operative in Gaza, which Hamas blamed on Israel (the IDF denied responsibility).
"Prime Minister Ehud Olmert's spokesman, Mark Regev... said that the fact Hamas fired dozens of mortars the day after Israel declared it wanted to give the Egyptian cease-fire track an additional chance 'shows who we are up against. This shows who Hamas is. They are committed to violence, not dialogue.' " -Shows official attribution to Hamas.

Description: "More than 50 rockets and mortar rounds were fired from the Gaza Strip on Tuesday night and Wednesday morning, the Israeli army said. One of the rockets hit a residential area of the Israeli city of Ashkelon, a spokesman said. There were no immediate reports of casualties from the attacks on southern Israel."
Context: "Dozens of rockets and mortar rounds were fired at Israel on Wednesday after Israeli forces killed six militants in the Gaza Strip, in the most serious incidents since a truce went into effect in June."

Description: Hamas launched rocket barrages at Ashkelon and Sderot, lightly wounding one in the latter.
Context: "Hamas claimed responsibility for the rocket fire, and said it fired deep into Israel to demonstrate the price the Jewish state would pay if the truce collapsed."

Description:
"mortar shells were fired from Hamas-ruled Gaza late Friday at an army base along Israel's border with territory. The Israeli military said eight soldiers were hurt, including two who were in serious condition."

Rival claim of responsibility between Hamas and Pop. Resistance Committees. "Some militants belong to both groups.... It was not immediately possible to confirm either claim."
Context: "The attack came after more than three weeks of renewed cross-border fighting. Israel and Hamas had agreed to a cease-fire in June, but the truce started to unravel in early November, following an Israeli cross-border raid. Israel has kept Gaza's borders closed since Nov. 5 to try to pressure militants to halt the attacks."

Description:
"Hamas gunmen launched more than 70 projectiles"

Two were Grads, which hit a house and an amusement park in Ashkelon. Strikes on Ashkelon usually provoke a heavy Israeli response.
Context:
"Israel... retaliated with a deadly air raid."

Hamas: retaliation for deadly air raid on previous day.

Description:
Israeli man killed when rocket hits his home in Netivot.
Some confusion here: earlier report said a woman was injured. Later report says a man was killed and that medics had previously said it was a woman. Not 100% certain these are one and the same incident, but pretty sure.
-"Hamas radio said militants had launched dozens of projectiles. In a statement, Hamas's military wing said it had fired off four. The Israeli army said three rockets and two mortars had fallen within Israel."
-Also can't be 100% sure that it was those rockets who killed the man, but they seem to be the only ones, hence attributing to Hamas/QB.
Context: Cast Lead begins today in Gaza.

Description:
"In Gaza, Hamas said it had fired two longer-range Grad rockets towards the southern Israeli city of Ashdod, 30 kilometres (18 miles) north of the coastal strip. There was no immediate confirmation from the Israeli side of whether the rockets hit."

Many other rockets, too, not clear how many of them fired by Hamas. No casualties reported from them, either.
Context: Cast Lead going on since yesterday.

Description:
"An Israeli Arab was killed and eight other people were wounded when one of the projectiles slammed into a construction site in the southern city of Ashkelon some 13 kilometres north of the Gaza border."

"Hamas militants... [fired] some 20 rockets into Israel" on Dec 29.
Context: Day 3 of Operation Cast Lead

Description:
Two incidents: "Rockets killed an Ashdod woman at a bus stop and a person near Nahal Oz."
"Five other people were also wounded, two seriously when the Kassam rocket struck near Nahal Oz. Four people were wounded - one seriously and three lightly - by the rocket that hit the Ashdod bus stop."
Context: Cast Lead in its third day.

Description: The way the report is written, it is difficult to distinguish whether the number of dead and wounded refer to new attacks on the 30th or include those already mentioned on the 29th. In any case, a solder was also killed by a mortar (is among the 4 listed above), the first to be killed during Cast Lead.
Context: Operation Cast Lead in its 4th day.

Description: "Hamas militants fired two rockets deep into Israel on Wednesday, both hitting near the desert city of Beersheva some 40 kilometres (24 miles) from the border of the Gaza Strip, the army said. The Grad-type rockets caused no injuries or damage, the Israeli media said."
Context: Cast Lead continues

Description: A Katyusha rocket exploded in the penalty area of third division Hapoel Ashkelon's stadium on Monday, just minutes before the players were about to begin their training session.
Context: Cast Lead ongoing

Description: "The Ezzedine Al-Qassam Brigades said in a statement they had fired a Grad-type rocket at the Hatzerim air force base west of the city Beersheva, some 40 kilometres (24 miles) from the Gaza border."
Context:
"Militants in Gaza have fired more than 250 rockets at Israel since the start of the Jewish state's massive bombardment of Hamas targets in Gaza on Saturday."
Note that the ones listed in this database are a fraction of this total, either because Hamas has not launched most of them or simply because many could not be attributed to Hamas and were not immediately claimed by Hamas or were simply ignored by news media.

Description: "Hamas continued to bombard residents of southern Israel. Rockets hit Friday morning in and around Beersheba and Ashkelon, which like other cities in Israel's south have largely been paralyzed since the fighting began on Dec. 27."
Context: Cast Lead ground offnseive continues

Description:
"Hamas targeted a civilian area in southern Israel with a phosphorous mortar on Wednesday.... The mortar landed in open territory near a kibbutz in the Eshkol Regional Council."

"By Wednesday evening, Hamas had fired 17 rockets at Israel, with two landing in the southern Coastal Plain region. Ashdod, Ashkelon, Beersheba and Sderot also came under rocket fire throughout the day. No injuries were reported during the rocket attacks."
Context: Cast Lead ongoing

Description: Hamas fired 19 rockets at southern Israel on Sunday. One struck the yard of a home in Ashdod and caused two shrapnel injuries.
Context: Day of unilateral cease-fires on both sides. Unlcear if attack before or after cease-fire, but I would guess before. Rockets were definitely launched afterwards, as well, but there is no suggestion that Hamas launched them.

Description: "Hamas gunmen fired mortar shells into Israel and opened fire on IDF troops who remained inside the Palestinian territory."
Context: Israel on penultimate day of troop withdrawal.

Description:
"Hamas said it had fired three mortar rounds against an Israeli army unit operating inside the Gaza Strip on Wednesday."

3 rounds fired (token response, thus can be classified under strategic definition of terrorism).
Context: Truce in effect for 10 days.

Description: "The Ezzedine Al-Qassam Brigades, said in a statement that it fired four mortar rounds at Israeli soldiers who had entered the territory east of the Al-Bureij refugee camp. An Israeli army spokewoman however, said that five mortar shells had been fired from Gaza into Israel without causing injuries or damage."
Context: Gaza War ended on Jan 21

Description: "Four Israelis were shot dead near the West Bank Jewish settlement of Kiryat Arba after nightfall."
Context: "Hamas... is vehemently opposed to the talks which Netanyahu and Palestinian president Mahmud Abbas are to relaunch in Washington on Wednesday" (i.e. the following day).

Description: "Late Wednesday two Israelis were wounded in a shooting as they drove in a car near the Jewish settlement of Rimonim, an Israeli army spokesman said."
Context: "Hamas... is vehemently opposed to the talks which Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu and Palestinian president Mahmud Abbas are relaunching in Washington."

Description:
Grad hits Beersheva. IDF reports it retaliated at "a terrorist squad in the northern Gaza Strip, in the same location where rockets were fired towards the Israeli city of Beersheva." Palestinian sources said all sites hit by the IDF were Hamas training centers. Leads to conclusion that Israel, at least, believed the attacks were launched by militants at Hamas training camps, making it likely Hamas was to blame.
"The left-wing Popular Front for the Liberation of Palestinian and the Ezzedine al-Qassem Brigades also issued statements saying they had fired mortar shells into Israel on Wednesday night." No further info on that, which is why I didn't make a separate incident for it.
Context: Israel retaliates, see description.

Description:
"Israel said 49 mortar bombs fell on or around Israeli communities near the border with the Gaza Strip."
"An Israeli military spokesman said two civilians were lightly wounded when three projectiles fell on Pithat Shalom in the Negev desert."
Context: "three days after an Israeli air strike killed two of [the Qassam Brigades'] members in the Gaza Strip."

Description: "Hamas militants fired an anti-tank missile at an Israeli school bus on Thursday, critically injuring a teenager, prompting the army to pound the the Gaza Strip, killing four and wounding more than 30. After the missile slammed into the bus, the Palestinians lobbed at least 45 mortar rounds and several rockets into southern Israel, hitting a house, and the army responded by staging multiple raids across the enclave."
Context:
"Late Thursday, in a bid to prevent further Israeli strikes, Hamas said it had got most armed Palestinian factions in Gaza to sign on to a ceasefire.
As the rockets flew over the border, Israel's Iron Dome short-range missile defence system intercepted a projectile heading for the southern port city of Ashkelon, in what was the first time such a system has ever been successfully used anywhere in a combat situation."

Description:
"Following the strikes, the self-declared truce called by Hamas appeared meaningless, with both Hamas and Islamic Jihad claiming mortar and rocket attacks on Israel on Friday."
No Israeli casualties mentioned... somewhat poorly written.
Context:
Attack on a school bus, then truce declaration, the day before (see incident 298).

Israel kills senior Hamas militant Tayser Abu Snima later that day in retaliation (source 397).

Description: "The armed wing of Hamas said on Saturday it had fired four Grad rockets at the Israeli town of Ofakim, where officials earlier reported two children had been lightly wounded."
Context: "third day of tit-for-tat attacks"

Description:
"Militants from the armed wing of the ruling Hamas movement said they had fired at least 10 rockets into Israel and would continue unless the air strikes ended."

NOTE: 45 rockets launched, 10 claimed by Hamas. No way of knowing if it was actually the Hamas rockets that caused the injuries in a direct hit to a border police outpost in Yad Mordechai.
Context:
-"The sharp increase in rocket fire came... shortly after an afternoon [Israeli] air strike targeted two men on a motorcycle in the central Gaza town of Deir al-Balah, injuring one of them critically."
-Sunday night/Monday morning, "gunmen from Sinai carried out an ambush along Israel's southern border with Egypt, killing an Israeli civilian." IDF says its strikes "in no way related" to this border attack.
-Hamas agrees Egypt-brokered truce again next day (source 396).

Description: "23 rockets and mortars hit southern Israel on Monday, causing light damages to electric cables and a number of structures, including a home and a sheep pen, but resulting in no injuries. Most of the projectiles were fired at communities in the vicinity of the town Ofakim, primarily the Eshkol region."
Context:
-"In response to the injury of civilians in the most recent strike on Rafah"
-"...first time since June that Hamas has taken responsibility for rockets fired into Israel."
-IDF launched attack near Khan Yunis, targeting "terrorist squads responsible for the rocket fire." Witnesses also say 2 mosques hit, IDF confirmed, saying it "had fired at a Hamas position in a...  mosque."

Description:
"Israel's military said armed groups had fired 72 rockets and mortar shells over the border since midnight, injuring six, two of them seriously. Police said two Thais were "seriously to critically wounded" and a third had light injuries.

Militants from Hamas and the PRC claimed responsibility for the rocket fire."
Context:
"Several hours after the militants fired the first rockets late Tuesday [not clear if Hamas also responsible for these], Israeli aircraft killed two militants from Hamas' armed wing, the Ezzedine al-Qassam Brigades, in northern Gaza, sparking even more rocket fire.
An early-morning raid near southern city of Rafah killed a third militant from the Popular Resistance Committees (PRC), and later a Hamas militant hurt in the evening strikes died of his injuries, medics said."

Description:
"'At least 18 rockets were fired at Israeli territory, without causing injuries or damage,' police spokesman Micky Rosenfeld told AFP..."

"[T]he Ezzedine al-Qassam Brigades... named at least five areas in southern Israel where it had targeted 'military sites' -- Sufa, Kissufim, Beeri, Yad Mordechai and Nahal Oz."
Context: "'This shelling was in response to the continuous Zionist bombing and terrorising of peaceful citizens, which most recently killed Suleiman Kamel al-Qara, as well as in response to the repeated incursions and attacks carried out by the occupation,' the group said referring to one of its own militants."

Description: "an Israeli soldier was wounded near the border east of Khan Yunis when a tunnel packed with explosives was detonated in an attack"
Context: "Several hours earlier, a 13-year-old Palestinian was shot dead by gunfire from an Israeli helicopter in the same area, medics and witnesses said."
